Predict method for policy_tree

Source: R/policy_tree.R
predict.policy_tree.Rd

Predict values based on fitted policy_tree object.

# S3 method for policy_tree
predict(object, newdata, ...)

Arguments

object

policy_tree object
newdata

A data frame with features
...

Additional arguments (currently ignored).

Value

A vector of predictions. Each element is an integer from 1 to d where d is the number of columns in the reward matrix.

Examples

# \donttest{
# Fit a depth two tree on doubly robust treatment effect estimates
# from a causal forest.
n <- 10000
p <- 5
X <- round(matrix(rnorm(n * p), n, p), 2)
W <- rbinom(n, 1, 1 / (1 + exp(X[, 3])))
tau <- 1 / (1 + exp((X[, 1] + X[, 2]) / 2)) - 0.5
Y <- X[, 3] + W * tau + rnorm(n)
c.forest <- grf::causal_forest(X, Y, W)
dr.scores <- double_robust_scores(c.forest)

tree <- policy_tree(X, dr.scores, 2)
tree

#> policy_tree object 
#> Tree depth:  2 
#> Actions:  1: control 2: treated 
#> Variable splits: 
#> (1) split_variable: X5  split_value: -0.28 
#>   (2) split_variable: X1  split_value: 0.11 
#>     (4) * action: 2 
#>     (5) * action: 1 
#>   (3) split_variable: X2  split_value: -0.98 
#>     (6) * action: 2 
#>     (7) * action: 1 

# Predict treatment assignment.
predicted <- predict(tree, X)

plot(X[, 1], X[, 2], col = predicted)

legend("topright", c("control", "treat"), col = c(1, 2), pch = 19)

abline(0, -1, lty = 2)

# }
